attributes.action: Protect SED's for Seafarers employed on Offshore Construction Vessels, DSV's, Survey etc.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Following a special commissioners decision, HMRC is significantly expanding the list of vessels it defines as not been a 'ship' - to include Construction, Construction Support, Well Service, Dive Support and Seismic Survey Vessels.
Seafarers working on these vessels will no longer qualify under the Seafarers Earnings Deduction (SED) income tax rules.
It is felt that this will decimate the British Merchant Navy fleet, during a time when the DfT is trying to regenerate the British maritime skills base, whilst HMRC seems intent on destroying it.
The concessions are for seafarers, and should be given irrespective of the vessel on which they work.
